reviews.text: As many others have said, this hotel is an excellent choice when going to Disneyland. We stayed here for one night. The price was okay - not super cheap but not too expensive either at $134/night.
reviews.title: No surprises - it's good

reviews.text: I won't go into all the positives because that's been mapped out very well by others. I will say that the bathroom was ready for an upgrade and the very loud fan in the bathroom got on my nerves. And the bed was too soft and a bit lumpy.
reviews.title: The Best>>>Simply The Best

reviews.text: But overall, the look of the hotel is very welcoming, and when you combine that with value and location, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Candy Cane Inn is brilliant

reviews.text: Great place to stay. Wonderful breakfast and great customer service. I will definately stay here again. I had 3 friends staying at other Hotels in the area and lets just say they were very jealous of my place. They have my business for life!
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

likes.liked: — The staff were GREAT and very accomodating.
likes.disliked: — The weak wireless service. (They only problem)

reviews.title: Sleep here if you want to sleep with cockroaches!
reviews.text: The location is perfect and the rooms are clean and spacious. The breakfast is good but the service and assistance given by the staff is what really makes this hotel top notch. i am telling all my friends to stay here. We had trouble organising tours on the next leg of our vacation and Kim in the office helped us arrange things over the internet. She went above and beyond the call of duty, really great service and with a smile! Thanks Kim

After alternating between some of the less expensive hotels, and the Disneyland Resort hotels, we opted to give a some of the intermediate priced hotels a try(we are Annual Passholders so we come to DL quite often). I am so glad we tried out the Candy Cane Inn last year. Last year they gave us a $10 credit certificate to use on our next stay, so we used it last week.
reviews.title: Hidden gem steps from Disneyland

reviews.text: We were greeted by friendly staff who welcomed us and got us all situated. There is coffee and candy canes in the lobby. I enjoyed the coffee after a long drive and the kids enjoyed the candy canes.
reviews.title: best for Disney

reviews.text: This place is extremely clean and you can clearly see the attention to detail in maintaining this place. The rooms are a cozy size with everything we needed in room. The contintental breakfast was a real continental breakfast, not just a plate of donuts like some places. There was different cereals for the kids, muffins, pastries, donuts, coffee, with jams and PB, cream cheese, etc. Juice and coffee to drink etc. And plenty of seating to sit and eat. So we saved money on breakfast.
reviews.title: Close to Disneyland but some disappointment

reviews.text: You can walk to Disneyland in around 10 minutes, but with 2 small kids, we opted for the free shuttle that runs every half hour.
reviews.title: Just Around The Corner

reviews.text: We were given another $10 certifiacte to use on next stay, and they allow you to use it with AAA discount, so it is pretty reasonable price. You can find cheaper hotels, but anything cheaper is NOWHERE near as clean. You can also get a more "magical" room at one of the resort hotels, but expect to pay at least double.
reviews.title: We had so much fun!

reviews.text: After staying at the Candy Cane Inn several times in the past, we swore we would never stay anywhere else. But after family we were traveling with booked another hotel with "points" we felt we had to stay where they were staying. Arriving in Anaheim to find this different hotel a complete nightmare (filthy, undergoing construction, horribly dated and a mile away from the Mouse House with no shuttle) we called the Candy Cane Inn. We were so thrilled that they had rooms for us and our family and allowed us to check in quickly and painlessly. Their breakfast is perfect, the accomodations clean and well kept and the staff is very friendly. We really will NEVER stay anywhere else again!!
reviews.title: Disney style & service at a great price!

reviews.text: First off for location it can't be beaten, minutes away from Disney so very convenient.
reviews.title: Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean and came with free wi-fi, good cable selection and a turn-down service. Breakfast had a good selection and you could sit by the pool which was nice. The staff were very friendly and always able to accomodate.
reviews.title: Best Hotel at Disneyland

reviews.text: The room had two double beds but was significantly small especially to accomodate four people and we had been told/paid to be booked into one of the largest. Also the mirror and sink area was in the bedroom, seperate to the bathroom which had no mirror or sink just a shower/bath and toilet. This was a nuisance as it meant brushing your teeth, shaving etc in the room yet showering in the bathroom and so having different amenities in different rooms. Also wardrobe space was very limited so lived mainly out of our bags.
reviews.title: Great stay yet again!

reviews.text: We have been staying here for several years, and can't say enough great things about this place. The rooms are clean and inviting, and the staff is extremely helpful. We've asked them about restaurants in the area and they've been right on the mark. The breakfast is a nice addition also and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting the Anaheim area.
reviews.title: Excellent place -- we will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here twice now, Sept 07 and May 06, both times its been great, quiet, local to disney, free breakfast, loads of parking, clean pool and hot tub, would recommend. For anaheim and disney do not stay anywhere else, if you will be in la a lot then stay up there as the I5 is a nightmare during rush hour.
reviews.title: Great stay 2nd time here

reviews.text: We have just returned from a fantastic stay in the USA, eight days of that were at the Candy Cane Inn. We arrived from Australia very early on the 20th December and had requested an early check in when we had booked earlier on in the year. We were'nt sure whether we would get one but were hopeful. We arrived at the CCI at about 9am and were able to go straight to our room. The deluxe room was nice, very clean and nicely decorated, with 2 queen beds. The motel itself was very quaint and looked much nicer than a lot of the motels close by. The pool was nice , although my daughter and I did'nt use it , my son and husband did, and said it was very warm.The breakfast was very nice, bagels,toast,muffins, fresh fruit and cereals always stocked up and well presented.I must say it was a little crowded in the breakfast area, but the motel was full the whole time we were there, so that's understandable.Wendy on the front desk was amazingly helpfull when it came t some questions we had, I think she is so good at her job. I also need to acknowledge James as being very helpfull as well, a big thank you to both.The bus drivers were also friendly as we used the shuttle bus a few times to Disneyland. All being said I would reccomed this motel to families who are going to Anaheim without a doubt and if we do go back I will most definately go back to the CCI. Thank You again.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Candy Cane Inn turned out to be a perfect spot for us to stay. It was very reasonable, had a nice handful of amenities including the shuttle and it was ideally located to the park. It's only about a 7 minute walk to the entrance. I thought the room was in good shape, and the hotel grounds were well done.
reviews.title: Nice spot to stay for a Disney Trip

reviews.text: We switched to the Candy Cane Inn after a VERY disappointing stay at a nearby hotel. We did not have reservations, we were lucky enough to call and were given two rooms near the center of the upper right hand side of the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly, professional and our stay was exactly as we wanted. The breakfast buffet was a big plus as I was traveling with 4 teen-age boys! We have stayed at several hotels at Disneyland and really for the amount of time that the kids and I are at the hotel, this is a perfect choice. It is close to the hotel, the shuttle is free but the walk is easy as it is on the same side as the entrance to Disney. There is a nearby convenience store, a spa and pool that is open fairly late for soaking tired feet and laundry facilities for drying wet clothes.
reviews.title: As before loved our stay!

likes.disliked: — loved the stay -- a microwave would have been nice though.

reviews.title: Happy At Candy Cane Inn
reviews.text: For those traveling with teen-agers, having the two adjoining rooms is ideal. It would have been very tight is one of the "suite hotels" that have a smaller room with twin or bunk beds in them. Another hint - although it wasn't hot and it did rain for a couple of hours while we were at the park, the kids loved the short lines!!! I would really recommend visiting during sprinkling days, it wasn't a problem at all!
We stayed here while at Disneyland and had a great experience.
reviews.title: great motel

reviews.text: The front desk personnel were always friendly and helpful, the breakfast was great, and the easy distance to Disney made walking or taking the free shuttle great options. Parking is free and right at your room.
reviews.title: Dont listen to the negative reviews!!

likes.liked: — Comfortable room, beautiful grounds and pool, clean, quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very clean motel.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

likes.liked: — Location, Staff, condition of the property

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasure staying there

reviews.text: My family and I have been staying here everytime we have visited Disneyland since 1992. It is a motel, not a hotel. But I think that's what I like about. You don't have all the noise and hustle and bustle of a larger hotel..It's very nice to come back here after a busy day at the park. It is very quaint and charming. The landscaping is beautiful. The staff is friendly. The pool is very nice..All in all ....just right, and very nice. I dont understand why anyone would write a bad review about this place. I would never spend $300 or more per night for one the "fancy" Disney hotels. You're goind to spend all your money at the park anyway, so why waste money on an overrated Disney hotel? This is a great choice for the price. We absolutely love it here!
reviews.title: Wonderful weekend stay

likes.disliked: — lots of kids early in the morning being excited and noisy about Disneyland

reviews.text: I visited Disneyland again for the holidays with my children. They requested we stay at the Candy Cane Inn for this visit. We have stayed several times at The Grand California Hotel but my kids prefer the charm and accommodations of this hotel.
reviews.title: Disneyland Again

reviews.text: Just like our first visit, the stay was wonderful. We chose a premium room this time and it wasnwellmworth it. The rooms are larger, they deliver a continental breakfast every morning and they have a DVD selection available. For the location and price this is my hotelmofnchoicenwhen visiting Disneyland.
reviews.title: The Best budget hotel in Anaheim!!!!

reviews.text: Here's the facts: Right next door to Disneyland. About 10 minute walk (My kids are 5 & 8 & they had no problems w/ the distance). 2 story bldg w/ no elevator. Staff more than willing to assist w/ luggage. Lge. parking lot w/ FREE parking!!!! (I believe most of the hotels around this area charge a fee). Small pool Continental breakfast: hot/cold beverages (tea, coffee, milk, hot cocoa), fresh fruit (oranges, apples, bananas), cold/hot cereals, pastries (muffins, danish, bread) which is a plus for budget travelers. Staff: friendly, courtesy & helpful. Rooms: very clean, all non-smoking, hair dryers & microwaves (no extra charge). Conveniences: 7/11 store, Subway, Tony Roma & Chinese restaurant w/in walking distance. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially those who are on a budget. They even mailed us a coupon that we could use on our next visit. DEFINITELY the only hotel we will stay @ when in the Anaheim area.
reviews.title: " Enjoyed Our Stay."

reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed at the Candy Cane and we have been very pleased with our experience. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are nicely kept. We really appreciated the very nice breakfast and free parking. Even though the motel is within walking distance to Disneyland, the shuttle service is nice to have at the end of a very long day.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: If we are ever back to Anaheim, we will be sure to stay at the Candy Cane Inn. Thanks to everyone there for a wonderful visit.
reviews.title: Great place to stay close to Disneyland

reviews.text: We have stay at this motel for the last four years. WHay do we keep coming back???? The excellent service, great location and incredibly clean beautiful grounds are the main lure.
reviews.title: Another Great stay :)
liked the place
reviews.text: The service is over and beyond what one might expect in even a 5 star hotel. One of the assistant managers, very pretty blonde girl, has been an asset over the years in giving us good local information on restaurants and shopping and such. We always look forward to seeing her. Jeff the manager was keen and attentive when we had a problem one day with the hot water. We always feel like we are being very very well taken care of.

reviews.title: Unfortunate experience
reviews.text: Location is a true 7 min walk from the ticket booths and what a blessing it is having the 7-11 hidden away next door. Our son loved the slushees there.....
Grounds are kept spotlessly clean and beautiful with the many flowers and plants. The rooms have always passed the white sock test.
reviews.title: Candy Cane Inn....Eeverything I had hoped for!
Great little motor inn
reviews.text: I travel a great deal for business and am always staying at "5-star" hotels. Is the Candy Cane a 5-starer??? For a family run motel, In my opinion it is....:)

We have made many trips to Disneyland and stayed at several locations in the past. Our first stay at the Candy Cane Inn was an excellent experience. The free breakfast was perfect for our needs. The inn is close enough to Disneyland's entrance to walk, but at the end of a long day the free shuttle was great. The room was clean and comfortable. Had a great sleep each night...very quiet. At half the price or less of the Disney operated hotels, the value can't be beaten. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Best value near Disneyland

reviews.text: After reading the many positive reviews and the the few negative reviews, I was unclear what to expect. After staying there from Friday thru Monday, I can honestly report it was one of the most positive lodging experiences I have had in Anaheim. I am a frequent Disneyland visitor and have stayed at various hotels, most recently the Fairfield Inn (sept 05). While I have no negative things to say about the other hotels, compared to the Candy Cane, they don't hold a candle. It was quieter, the staff friendlier, the room more updated and altogether better in every way. The only negative I have to report is the breakfast was very crowded, but we showed up early and this was easily remidied. The pool was warm and the staff was incredible. I think I have found a new home at the Candy Cane Inn.
reviews.title: Incredible
A Fantastic Experience at the Candy Cane Inn
reviews.text: Our family of four (children 5 and 8) spent 10 nights at the Candy Cane (after alot of online research) during a peak part of the summer season and the experience exceeded our expectations on every level. We drove all the way from Winnipeg, Manitoba (Canada) with the main part of our vacation being at Disneyland and we were so thrilled upon arrival that the Candy Cane lived up to all its great reviews. The Staff was outstanding and everything connected to the hotel, the rooms, the service, the food, the pool, the grounds, and the shuttle was above average. We had a premium room which is definitely worth the slightly higher charge as having breakfast delivered to the room makes getting to Disneyland early even easier. We love Disneyland and want to go back this year and I wouldn't stay anywhere else other than the Candy Cane Inn. Keep up the great work Candy Cane Inn - this kind of quality service is hard to come by!

reviews.title: We'll never stay anywhere else....
reviews.text: We usually use Priceline and stay at a variety of places, at great rates, but this time we had an extra family member so we had to make a direct reservation with a hotel. We researched like crazy and noticed that we read nothing but great comments about the Candy Cane. I can honestly and without reservation say that the Candy Cane Inn is the absolute best value near Disneyland. I have never stayed in a cleaner, better maintained hotel. The place is small, quiet, quaint and beautiful. The staff were top notch. One of our kids threw up in their bed in the middle of the night and staff were at our door within 5 minutes with completely new linens. We needed help with transportation to the train station and when I asked for advice, Nick at the front desk took over and just arranged it for me. The shuttle ran perfectly on time and the drivers along with all of the staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and professional. This place is a gem and I'd recommend it over any of the larger hotels that are typically considered more luxurious. Stay at the Candy Cane and you will not be disappointed...guaranteed.

reviews.title: Loved the Candy Cane Inn
reviews.text: The excitement of our 8 yr. old granddaughter visiting Disneyland for the first time last Nov. was overwhelming and our arrival at Candy Cane Inn exceeded our expectations. Not only were we next door to Disneyland Park, our accommodations were quality and the staff went out of their way to see that our granddaughter's dreams began at their hotel. The turn-down service included Disney character candies on the pillow. A menu with easy to follow directions for room delivery of breakfast was on the table and the selection was great. It saved us time and money. Shuttle service to and from the park was convenient and frequent.

This was our 5th trip to anaheim but our first time at the Candy Cane. Our fam of 5 stayed here for 6 nights. It is a beautiful property, lots of flowers and trees, very nice. We found the front desk staff to be very kind when checking in and very helpful when renting a car. The rooms are very clean although a bit small for all 5 of us but we spent very little time in our room. We loved the continental breakfast delivered to our room every morning(toasted bagels, donuts, muffins, cereal, fruit, tea, coffee, juice, milk etc...) It was perfect, made getting ready for our day quick and easy! Its an easy walk to Disneyland the free private shuttle was nice after a long day. The pool is small but my kids loved it! Really the only thing that was a bummer was no view of the fireworks at night! In the past we have stayed at Best Western park place inn, The fairfield, Park vue, and Jolly Roger which all have a view of disneyland & the fireworks but all in all The Candy Cane inn is the one who gets our return business!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — No view of Disneyland or fireworks

reviews.text: we'd all be very happy people. I've stayed at many, many motels, hotels and resorts around Disneyland over the years; never stayed at the Candy Cane Inn. I remember walking by it as a child wanting to stay there, for some reason we always ended up at the Jolly Roger. Finally had my chance this last Friday and it didn't disappoint. From the grounds to the additional amenities,(late check out, breakfast brought to the room, snacks upon arrival, free video rentals, bathrobes (at a motel!), real flowers in the room, free wi-fi, early parking, a refrigerator and a microwave, on time buses) the Candy Cane Inn is IT. Do yourself a favor, stop reading the reviews and reserve yourself a room. You'll thank me later!!
reviews.title: If every motel was like this...

likes.liked: — This is the motel you've always imagined staying at.
likes.disliked: — I prefer a hard bed, but the rest of the family loved them.

reviews.text: Booked through Disney Travel and initially we had selected a different property via the website. I spoke to an agent with Disney Travel who recommended this property instead and we have never been more happy. The devil is in the details and there are many here including the stone parking lot and the extended continental breakfast. There is a free shuttle to the park, even though it is only a slowly paced 10 minute walk away, that runs every 30 minutes. We found the shuttle very helpful after walking around the park. The best plan for us was to go to Disney in the morning, return to the hotel in the mid-afternoon to give the kids some pool time during the
reviews.title: Candy Cane is an excellent stay

reviews.text: peak crowd and heat hours. Then we returned to the park during the cool evening time. The Candy Cane Inn is a well appointed with a great staff and is a welcome oasis just on the edge of Disney. We will be going back!
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: I admit that I bounced back and forth between the Candy Cane and the Disney properties. I ended up splitting my stay between the Candy Cane and the Grand Californian. Yes, there were differences between the two, but I can honestly say that I'd stay at the Candy Cane again! I booked a premium room at a AAA rate and thought I got my money's worth. The room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast (delivered to your room at this room level) was more than adequate. (Who could complain about carafes of juice and coffee? Croissant? You got it. Cereal? Toast? Muffin? Donut? Fresh fruit? No problem!) The property is walking distance to the parks and the shuttle isn't hard to find if you need it. There are abundant flowers and greenery on the grounds and the pool area looked clean and nice. All in all, I found everyone friendly and the motel a 'do again'! (BTW, if you are looking for a place to buy a bit of alcohol to bring back to your room, there's a convenience store right on the corner!)
reviews.title: Loved the Candy Cane Inn!

reviews.text: We will definitely stay here again. Clean, nice, comfy rooms, great mattresses. I sleep very light....no noise from other rooms. (We had an upstairs room.) Very accommodating staff. Our kids and grandkids were put in a room next to us so we could be close. Wireless free internet was a plus. Hot tub every night was wonderful. Nice swimming pool, both for the kids and adults. Plenty of seating. Continental breakfast was okay...great for kids without extra expense. Great for those not needing a full on cooked breakfast, which we didn't need. Fruits, pastries, cereal, bagels and cream cheese, toaster, hot chocolate, coffee, tea, juices. Shuttle runs back and forth to entry of Disney. We walked quite a few times, moderate distance but do-able. Lots of restaurants in the immediate 2 blocks and a 7-11 right next door as well as another gift/quick shop steps away. Whenever we return, we will stay here again.
reviews.title: I rely heavily on these reviews...this one didn't let me down!

likes.disliked: — the chlorine in the hot tub and pool

reviews.text: the staff was great, the rooms were clean, the breakfast was very good, but does need a little updating. the air conditioner in room 267 needs to be serviced, it was a lillte loud. James from the front desk was a lifesaver for us. our camera got broken on our 2nd day, and he took time out of his day to actually take us to get a new one at circuit city. that was above and beyond excellence. we really appreciate the candy cane inn, and would recommend it to anyone wanting to have a nice vacation at disney. the shuttle runs every 30 min all day, and till after the park closes, so this is very convienent. thank you again!!!
reviews.title: another great stay at the candy cane inn

reviews.text: My friends and I chose this hotel after extensive research on different travel websites and Tripadvisor reviews. Candy Cane was all we expected. We were not disappointed. It truly has fanstastic landscaping which makes it stand out from most hotels around Disneyland.
reviews.title: A Hidden Jewel

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and beds extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.text: They are not huge rooms but we upgraded to the Deluxe room which is 40sq feet larger (free w/ your AAA membership).
reviews.title: Overall Great

reviews.text: We stayed at the Candy Cane for a one day visit to DL park. I couldn't have been happier with the service and amenities of this great hotel! The room was clean and spacious and the staff was wonderful. The continental breakfast offered fruits, oatmeal, bagels/toast and an assortment of teas and beverages. We were able to leave our car in the parking lot during our day at the park and were given passes for the shuttle that evening (even though we had checked out of our room).
reviews.title: Short, but Sweet, Stay at the Candy Cane!

reviews.text: The hotel appeared to be meticulously maintained and had a very welcoming feel to it. The plantings around the property were beautiful and just added to the charm.
reviews.title: High Expectations Met

reviews.text: We would wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone planning a visit to the DL park!
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: We booked a 3 night Disney Good Neighbour package at the Candy Cane based on the excellent reviews on this site, and recommendations from various Disney websites. Booking was straight forward; we used the Disneyland website itself.
reviews.title: Great choice!!
Great!
reviews.text: Our original plans changed slightly, and we ended up in Los Angeles earlier than intended, so we drove to Anaheim and booked an extra two nights at the Candy Cane. The staff member there was very obliging and helpful. We checked in around midnight on the Monday, a slight criticism might be that as it was so late, a discounted room rate could have been offered.

We just returned from a trip to Disneyland. I used to live there and have stayed at all the large resort type hotels, including all the Disney resorts. I would say that my family and I found our stay at the Candy Cane Inn to be the best experience we have had ever in visiting Disneyland (at least twice yearly). They offer free self-parking, family friendly, frequent shuttle service (every half hour) and also close enough to walk to the park even when your tired. The beds are comfortable, rooms clean and they offer a continental breakfast that the entire family enjoyed. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.
reviews.title: Loved the small, quaint lodging

likes.disliked: — No elevator and some rooms are tucked away.

reviews.text: Candy Cane Inn…Charming and excellent. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. They turned us on to places to eat and found us a real gem! Check out Bella Marri’s for a fantastic place to eat if you like Italian food. They were so amazing and offer free limousine service to and from the hotel. The driver not only got us to and from the hotel, but also offered to take us to Disneyland after we grabbed our stuff for the evening. Five stars to Bella Marri’s for a wonderful time and the prices also were amazing! Just ask the staff at the Inn for a menu to make a reservation!
reviews.title: Toontastic!

reviews.text: The rooms at the Inn were spotless and well kept and not a cockroach in sight! It is situated close to Disneyland while maintaining a quaint country cottage appeal. The shuttle was a great touch and if you missed one the next was less than a half hour away. It was easy to schedule your day around the shuttle so you got to the parks when you wanted to be there. We never had to walk to Disneyland, but others told us it was just a 7 to 10 minute walk. I would definitely stay here again without hesitation. In fact I don’t think we will consider anywhere else unless they are fully booked. We didn’t spend much time in the rooms, but were grateful of them at the end of a long day. Comfy beds for sore tired feet! The pool and spa were well used for a late afternoon break from walking and it was just delightful in the evening.
reviews.title: great place to stay

likes.disliked: — my room was next to the hotel cleaning closet - heard the large towel carts every evening after the pool closed

reviews.text: If you are looking for the Ritz this isn’t it, but you would be hard pressed to find a more appealing family style hotel that is priced right and offers breakfast to start your day and makes you feel right at home. Three cheers to the Candy Cane Inn and its wonderful staff!
reviews.title: great time at candycane

likes.liked: — Clean , well looked after and very good staff .
likes.disliked: — Little to do outside of hotel grounds other than Disney . No problem if you have a car though .

reviews.text: Once again, my daughter and I stayed at the Candy Cane Inn during a three day visit to Disneyland. The front desk staff were very helpful, especially Nick the manager. He went out of his way to find me a local Verizon cell phone store. The rooms were quiet, clean, and the beds were very comfortable. You can't miss with the Candy Cane Inn, as it is literally the first hotel south of the main gate to Disneyland. We did use the shuttle once or twice to go to the park, and we walked back to the hotel in the evening - very safe area as far as I could tell. Rest assured that I will be staying here every time I go to Disneyland from now on!
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn several times now. I especially love the "garden feel" that encompassed the inn. It feels less commercialized than other hotels in this area. Not only is the service excellent, but the value is too. Free parking, 8 minute walk to the Disneyland gates, cotton linens, down comforters, comfortable beds, a 7-11 next door for emergencies and a great expanded breakfast. They also have a small wading pool for toddlers.
reviews.title: The Candy Cane Inn is a GEM!

likes.liked: — Comfortable beds, great service and breakfast, value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most recent time we stayed here, we had a bit of a slow drain in the tub. We dropped a note off to the front desk on our way to Disneyland and upon arriving back that late night, the problem had been fixed. We would recommend this inn to anyone traveling with or without kids. It's a great family hotel!
reviews.title: Great Value at Candy Cane Inn

likes.liked: — Friendly, helpful staff and nicely kept grounds
likes.disliked: — Day time shuttle bus driver had no customer service training and seemed annoyed that he actually had passengers!

reviews.text: Our stay at the Candy Cane Inn was as good as we expected after reading all the reviews posted on TripAdvisor. The property was well kept, the room was certainly adequate, and the staff was very friendly and hepful. The walk to the entrance to Disneyland was quite easy and pleasant, but it was also nice to have the shuttle pick us up and bring us back at the end of the night. The only negative was that the day time shuttle bus driver was bordering on rude. He was not at all friendly as other reviewers had said, and he was completely uninterested in the fact that he had left us waiting on the bus for 20 minutes at the Inn when we boarded at the posted departure time so he could take a break, I guess. He was nasty, but that was the only bad experience of the stay. (The night driver was fine.) Walking was easy and we didn't have to deal with his negative attitude.
reviews.title: near Disneyland

likes.disliked: — not clean enough, small room, some moise at night, crowded breakfast

reviews.text: We highly recommend the Candy Cane Inn if you want to stay near Disneyland at a reasonable cost in a very nice motel within walking distance.
reviews.title: Look No Further, Candy Cane Is It!

likes.disliked: — room was small for us since we filled it with 2 adults, 2 big teenagers and a 10 year old

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Candy Cane when visiting Disneyland.
reviews.title: Fun Atmosphere

reviews.text: Our family of 4 just returned from an 11-night stay at the Candy Cane Inn during the height of Disney's busy season. We used the reviews here to help make our decision and were not disappointed. Check-in and check-out were handled easily, all of the staff (front desk, food services, pool, maintenance, cleaning and grounds personnel, housekeepers and shuttle drivers) were competent and friendly. The room and motel property as a whole were kept immaculate. The lush plants everywhere and the cobblestone parking areas, etc. take away the "concrete jungle" effect once you step onto the property from the street.
reviews.title: A sweet reTreat

reviews.text: The contintental breakfast was well-replenished and very fresh every morning. With a large assortment of bread, danishes, croissants, bagels, muffins, donuts, spreads (cream cheeses, jams, honey, etc), cold cereals, hot cereal packets, fresh fruit (oranges, bananas, apples), fruit juices and hot drinks, we were able to eat a good breakfast every morning and not tire of it. There are not enough tables to handle everyone, but there is a tray in each room and breakfast can be brought back to the room.
reviews.title: Clean, clean, clean!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The room was comfortable, clean and very quiet. At no time did we hear street noise or our neighbors beside or below us. The room had a small fridge which we made use of. It was turned on and cold upon arrival. We sometimes returned to the motel for an early/mid afternoon swim and always returned to a clean room. We left a small tip each day for the person who cleaned the room and would often find a little thank-you note when we returned. The coffee maker in the room did not work (this was not a big deal to us), though we did mention it on our way to the park, and a brand new one had been placed in our room by the time we returned.
reviews.title: Excellent - Clean - Very Cute - Great Disney Shuttle Service - Great Breakfast!
Lived up to previous reviews
reviews.text: Due to the very busy season, parking was at a premium. We always found a place for our rental car, though not always near the room.
We did laundry once. The washers and dryers were large in size and cost was $1 per load and $1 for soap if you didn't bring your own.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because of the great reviews. Very nice and clean. Staff is very friendly. Shuttle service was great, walking wasn't far at all about 10 min walk. Breakfast was simple and it was nice to eat around the pool. When we came back to our room each night the room looked like when we checked in, the maid service was perfect. There are restaurants within walking distance, bubba gump was good and so was california pizza.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: We definitely will stay there again.
reviews.title: It met our expectations...

reviews.text: Our family of five, consists of 2 adults and 3 children, had recently stayed here for 5 nights when we visited Disneyland in Anaheim. The room had 2 queen-sized beds plus a rollaway, yet still had enough room to move around comfortably. Breakfasts were inclusive although it was just some simple pastries, fruit juices and coffee. But there were lot of fresh fruits such as banana, apple and orange! Very healthy. Internet was free but with no services for 2 nights. Informed the problem to management and got it fixed in no time. Good customer service. Liked their laundry facility as we can do our own laundry after coming back from the Disneyland park. Definitely recommend to family who want a place to stay near Disney.
reviews.title: Location and Convenience good for Disneyland

reviews.text: Visited Thanksgiving week 2011.
reviews.title: It met our expectations...

reviews.text: The good things: On time shuttle that was free. Free parking. We had the deluxe room and the continental breakfast delivered every morning (free with Deluxe room) was great. The room size and amenities was good for the price.
reviews.title: Don't think twice!

reviews.text: We stayed at the CCI for 13 nights and were relieved to find on our arrival that everything is just how it is portrayed. The front desk staff were very friendly and expedient when checking us in, and allowed us to keep our luggage in storage, as we arrived just before lunch and our room wasn't ready for us yet.
reviews.title: Everything you need and more!

reviews.text: We walked to the parks every time we went, and caught the CCI bus back to the hotel at night. We never had to wait for long, and the drivers were fabulous and also very friendly!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.text: We loved the delivery of breakfast to our room every morning and always had plenty to eat.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: If we were fortunate enough to travel to Anaheim again, we would most definitely stay at the Candy Cane... and have no trouble whatsoever, referring it to others with confidence.
reviews.title: It is Mickey Mouse fault....

reviews.text: We stay every year in early December before the holiday crowds. Disney is a 10 minute walk away (faster than their shuttle if you miss it...it leaves every half hour). The grounds are so pretty with the care given to the flowers, vines and plants. The pool is great, the hot tub even better and they have a little child's pool, all surrounded with piped-in music. Their morning breakfast has yogurt, croissants, patstries and muffins, bagels, cereals of many choices, orange and apple juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, hot cereals and a basket full of fresh fruit. Right next door is an ABC mart with all the sundries you might have forgotten, snacks, touristy novelties, and Disney clothing. Have stayed "closer" to Disneyland at the main gate hotels, but those hotels leave a lot to be desired, are overused and overcrowded.
reviews.title: We love this place and wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — Clean Beautiful Grounds and Rooms and the Staff is Super Friendly!
